abstraction

Class Picker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • abstraction.Picker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributePicker, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiPicker, SimplePicker

    public abstract class Picker
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements AttributePicker
    This abstract class defines the things a Picker object can do.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • updateItems

        public void updateItems()
        Updates the entries of the DB. Stores the entries in an ArrayList, and then it shows it in a Jtable or Jlist.

      • setRequired

        public void setRequired(boolean isRequired)
        Defines if it is obligatory for the user to choose at least one entry. Giving it a true, it means it is neccesary.

      • search

        protected void search()
        Filter the table's contents.

      • setBannerText

        public abstract void setBannerText(java.lang.String text)
        Defines the text of this component's banner.
        Parameters:
        text - String with the text to set.

      • getSelection

        public abstract java.lang.Object getSelection()
        Returns the selected objects. Returns an ArrayList if the user selected more than one.
        Returns:
        Returns an object, or an ArrayList of them.

      • selectionIsValid

        public abstract boolean selectionIsValid()
        Returns true if the user selection is valid, returns false otherwise.

      • clearObjects

        protected abstract void clearObjects()
        Removes all the objects of the list/table model.

        protected abstract void populateArrayList()
        Retrieves data from the DB and stores it in a ArrayList.

      • showOnScreen

        protected abstract void showOnScreen(java.util.ArrayList entries)
        Shows entries in the table/list.
        Parameters:
        entries - ArrayList with the entries to show.

      • filterEntries

        protected abstract java.util.ArrayList filterEntries()
        Filters the entries saved on the ArrayList.
        Returns:
        Returns a new ArrayList with filtered items.
